features: Strong and durable up to 200 degrees Fahrenheit

body.description: World Centric compostable assorted utensils are biodegradable, and will take 120+ days to compost in a commercial composting facility. Home composting is not recommended and it may take 1-2 years to compost in a home composting system. Most current utensils on the market made from plant starch are not compostable since current technology does not allow for manufacturing plant starch utensils without adding some plastic fillers. Since these plant starch utensils do not meet compostability standards they are normally priced cheaper. Our utensils are made from tpla (70% Non-GMO pla and 30% talc.) They are also heat resistant up to 200 degrees f, and are certified under astm-6400 standards and now have bpi certification. Includes one 24 count of World Centric compostable assorted utensil. A different kind of product from a different kind of company.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #231,506 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #727 in Disposable Spoons

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Switch to these now
reviews.reviewText: These are awesome. I feel guilty using unrecyclable disposable plastic (petrochemical) cutlery, cups, etc., but these are fully compostable!*Easily distinguishable from other disposable cutlery due to the loop in the handle. Surprisingly strong, Strangely elegant, classy. No burrs or barbs like on typical plastics. Good price point. Highly recommend.This company has a lot of other items too and I am excited. Even lazy as I am, not wanting to wash dishes, plastic waste is still a luxury with severe negative consequences we can no longer afford. But these are guilt free!*UpdateI was saddened to learn that not all "compostable" packaging and cutlery actually breaks down in every industrial or home composting operation and that not all city yard waste services will accept hard commercial "compostables" for pickup, according to investigative reporting. The packaging states these maintain their integrity up to 200 degrees F so it would seem that a minimum temperature is required to break them down into compost. Best to follow local municipal guidelines. I am fortunate that Seattle has a huge and successful large scale composting operation that does take all kinds of food service packaging products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this utensil set
reviews.reviewText: I probably will sound a bit strange, but I really love these disposable utensils. So much so, that I reuse them over and over and have also purchased several sets.These are great because:- The spoons scoop up just the perfect amount of food for toddler and adult alike. I dislike most toddler utensils because the spoons barely hold anything to constitute as "food". I love these because they are the perfect size for tasting spoons for when I cook. This leaves my real silverware for setting the table.- The forks are great because (again) it actually holds food onto it without the ends being super sharp, which is super important for me as a parent. Again, I dislike most toddler forks because they often barely hold any food or don't have enough depth to pierce the food. These forks minimize the mess on the floor at mealtimes.- The knives (even) are great. They have a great strength without it being long / thick. And most grocery stores carry über expensive (e.g., "diamond weight") disposable utensils or super cheap utensils that are just as useless as toddler silverware.These utensils by World Centric are so great - PLUS, they are environmentally friendly. I use these till they drop (er, break - as a few of my spoons have snapped), but I love them so much that I use them for "scoops" for my instant coffee, sugar, etc.I know, I sound weird for gushing about disposable 'ware, but try these and you will not go back!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
reviews.reviewText: They are a bit expensive but the design is great!! I first found them in Whole Foods. They are reusable and supposedly more environmentally friendlier than normal plastic utensils. Very sturdy. I accidentally put one in the dish washer and they came out fine. Love them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great but pricey
reviews.reviewText: These are great but pricey. Sometimes I'd wash and reuse them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This cornstarch product was very nice, similar to plastic but eco friendlier
reviews.reviewText: Looking for an eco friendly utensil. Just not a fan of wood utensils. In general their tines too short on the fork, worry about splinters as they all seem to have a few. This cornstarch product was very nice, similar to plastic but eco friendlier. Very sturdy, can be reused too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Loved these. Worked well during a quarantine episode w a family member. They used disposable utensils. Biodegradable and sturdy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bio degradable/compostable picnic ware.
reviews.reviewText: These are sturdy, much more so than typical plastic picnic ware. I learned of these in a local restaurant, looked them up, and found them here. It's what we'll be using in picnics from now on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great choice for camping supplies
reviews.reviewText: Although I am making a concerted effort to not buy disposable items, it is great to have these as a supplement to our camping supplies. We wash and re-use them multiple times and feel better about disposing of them when the time comes. They are sturdy and the handle is attractive enough to use them for casual special occasion parties.
